table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to the sound, and not to any letter or glyph.
Dies bezieht sich auf den Laut, nicht den Buchstaben oder das Zeichen.
Namnet på ett ljud, inte en skriven bokstav eller glyf.
Ceci se réfère au son, pas à la lettre ou au glyphe.

table.name: mem
table.column: be gigantic, be huge, be humongous
غول پیکر باشید، بزرگ باشید، بزرگ باشید [AUTOTRANSLATED]
vara gigantisk, vara enorm, vara enorm [AUTOTRANSLATED]
быть гигантским, быть огромным, быть огромным [AUTOTRANSLATED]
變得巨大，變得巨大，變得巨大 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
sois gigantesque, sois énorme, sois énorme [AUTOTRANSLATED]

"Gargantua and Pantagruel" is a series of novels written by François Rabelais about two giants.
Maybe just a coincidence: this is also the word for "big" in Aramaic, Syriac, and other Semitic languages.

table.name: mem
table.column: укреплять, подбадривать, поддерживать, давать силы, строить укрепление, усиливать

When this verb is applied to a person, it suggests an improvement in health. When it is applied to an inanimate object, it implies improvement or betterment. It is distinguished from {tI':v} because that verb is not usually applied to living beings, and suggests a restoration to a previous state and not improvement. It also differs from {Dub:v} in that that verb is used for improvement of a more abstract nature.[1]

Когда этот глагол применен, к какому-то лицу, то он предполагает улучшение здоровья. Когда глагол применен к неодушевленному объекту, подразумевается улучшение или совершенствование. Имеет отличия от {tI':v} потому что тот глагол обычно не применяется к живым существам, и подразумевает восстановление предыдущего состояния, а не улучшения. Также отличается от {Dub:v} в том, что тот глагол используется для описания улучшений абстрактных вещей.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: There is no single term for "nurse" in Klingon. Other possible terms for a doctor's assistant are {Qel boQ@@Qel:n:1h, boQ:n:1h} (or {HaqwI' boQ@@HaqwI':n, boQ:n:1h} if the doctor is a surgeon) and {QelHom:n:nolink}.[1]
Nurse "Ratch"ed, from "One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest".

table.name: mem
table.column: подчинять, добиваться, заставлять, вынуждать, брать силой, навязывать, принуждать, вымучивать, нагнетать, взламывать, неволить, приневоливать, напрягать

table.name: mem
table.column: распадаться, разрушаться, разлагаться, хиреть, приходить в упадок, загнивать, ветшать, истлевать, ржаветь, проедать, вытравлять, портиться

table.name: mem
table.column: 娃娃、動作人物、微型人形 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
boneca, figura de ação, humanóide em miniatura
Raggedy Ann is a popular doll.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a type of food made from live serpent worms (not to be confused with {qagh:n}).

table.name: mem
table.column: Rajma is red kidney bean curry.

table.name: mem
table.column: быть насильственным, быть неистовым, быть яростным

table.name: mem
table.column: be trivial, be trifling, be unimportant, be insignificant
بی اهمیت بودن، بی ارزش بودن، بی اهمیت بودن، بی اهمیت باشد [AUTOTRANSLATED]
vara trivial, vara obetydlig, vara oviktig, vara insignifikant
быть тривиальным, быть банальным, быть незначительным, быть обыденным, быть пустяковым, быть плёвым, быть пустячным, быть неважным, быть малозначительным, быть несущественным
瑣碎、瑣碎、不重要、無足輕重 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
ser trivial, ser insignificante, ser sem importância
être insignifiant, être insignifiant, être sans importance, être insignifiant [AUTOTRANSLATED]
This was defined as "be trivial, be trifling, be unimportant" in {TKD:src}, and as "be insignificant" in {KGT:src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: The opposite of this is {pem:n}, not {jaj:n}.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: Avian life-form indigenous to {Qo'noS:n} that only comes out in the dark.
Птичья жизненная форма, являющаяся коренной на {Qo'noS:n}, что приходит только в темноте.

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to a non-sweet Klingon version of chewing gum. It's also used for the Terran version, sometimes preceded by {Su'ghar:n:nolink} or {tera':n}.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: This means "be in charge of, have authority over". It would be weird for this verb to be used without an object. There is some overlap in meaning with {ngoy':v}.[2]
Это значит "быть за старшего, иметь власть над кем-то". Будет странным для этого глагола использоваться без объекта.[2]
Olisi outoa käyttää tätä ilman objektia. Merkitys on osittain päällekkäinen verbin {ngoy':v} kanssa.[2]
be in charge of, have authority over
быть за старшего, иметь власть над кем-то

table.name: mem
table.column:
The subject of {rap:v:nolink} are the things which are the same.[2]
This verb can also be used to express the concept that two things have the same amount of some quality. The verb {nIb:v} is used similarly, but it is usually used with measurable qualities and has the connotation of preciseness. However, it is not improper to use {rap:v:nolink} with a quality that is measurable. See the examples below.[3]

Субъектом для {rap:v:nolink} являются вещи, являющиеся одинаковыми.[2]
Этот глагол также может использоваться, чтобы выразить идею, что две вещи находятся в одинаковом количестве или имеют одинаковое качество. Глагол {nIb:v} использован похожим образом, но обычно он используется в качестве измерения и имеет оттенок точности. Тем не менее, он не является неподходящим для использования {rap:v:nolink} в качестве измерения. Смотрите примеры ниже.[3]
▶ {ghun 'Iw HIq, rap boqrat chej.} "The bokrat liver is as warm as the bloodwine."[3] ▶ {'ey ro'qegh'Iwchab, rap qagh.} "The gagh is as delicious as the rokeg blood pie."[3]
▶ {ghun 'Iw HIq, rap boqrat chej.} "Печень бократа такая же теплая, как кровавое вино."[3] ▶ {'ey ro'qegh'Iwchab, rap qagh.} "Гагх такой же вкусный, как кровавый пирог."[3]

table.name: mem
table.column: The Star-Spangled Banner has the phrase "o'er the ramparts we watched", and {rapmar:n:nolink} reversed sounds like "rampart".

table.name: mem
table.column: This indicates that something is a repeat or an extra of something else. It can be used to describe the concept of {bIraqlul:n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is someone who captures and robs other ships on the sea (or in space), but with the permission of their government. It is sometimes shortened to {raqchap:n}.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column:
This can be applied to the arts, weapons, or spaceships. It refers to any activity which involves having some control over some object. In the context of swords, it can be used with a similar meaning to {yan:v}. In the context of spaceships (see {Duj:n:1}), this refers to controlling a vessel "manually", rather than by computer.[1, p.79]
In contrast to {ruQ:v:nolink}, which is more likely to be used when the handling alters the configuration of the thing being manipulated, {raQ:v:nolink} is used when the thing being handled doesn't do anything if it's not being handled. {raQ:v:nolink} is used when manually controlling a spaceship using switches or buttons and so on, as opposed to letting the computer control things automatically. But {ruQ:v:nolink} would be used if someone is manually controlling the thrusters by physically doing something to them directly, like yanking a thruster component, or twisting something, or banging on something.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: When stapling papers together (see {Ha'on vevwI':n}), the papers are the object of {rar:v:nolink}.[2]
Когда скрепляют бумаги вместе, смотрите {Ha'on vevwI':n}, бумаги являются объектом для {rar:v:nolink}.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: miteinander verbunden sein, miteinander zu tun haben
This means the subjects are generally or conceptually related.

table.name: mem
table.column: stanna kvar, finnas kvar, återstå, ha kvar, vara kvar

table.name: mem
table.column:
Note that each floor, or level, on a vessel is called a {choQ:n} (deck).
There is a Klingon idiom, {'IQ; rav rur@@'IQ:v, rav:n:1, rur:v}.[2]

Заметьте, что каждый этаж или уровень на судне называются {choQ:n} (палуба).
Есть Клингонская идиома, {'IQ; rav rur@@'IQ:v, rav:n:1, rur:v}.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: It's unclear why {rav:n:2,nolink} seems to follow the noun while {'aqroS:n:2,nolink} seems to precede the noun.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is used to express the idea of some (perhaps unknown) point between two ends of a range. To express the full stretch of the entire range, use {qubbID:n:1} instead.[1]

▶ {QujwI' ghom rav:sen:nolink}: {cha'; 'aqroS:sen:nolink}: {jav:sen:nolink} "2 to 6 players"[2] ▶ {rav cha' 'uj(mey) 'aqroS loS 'uj(mey) 'ab:sen@@rav ...:sen, cha':n:num, 'uj:n, -mey:n, 'aqroS ...:sen, loS:n:1,num, 'uj:n, -mey:n, 'ab:v:1} "has a length between two and four ujes" (it's at least two ujes and no more than four)[1] ▶ {rav DaSjaj 'aqroS buqjaj maghom:sen@@rav:n:2, DaSjaj:n, 'aqroS:n:2, buqjaj:n, ma-:v, ghom:v} "we meet between Monday and Friday", "we meet at some point between Monday and Friday"[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to stand-alone (moveable) furniture only, not something built-in.
Dies bezieht sich nur auf eigenständige (bewegliche) Möbel, nicht auf etwas Eingebautes.
Feodor Ingvar Kamprad was the founder of the IKEA furniture company.

table.name: mem
table.column: innertak (i ett rum med ett rum till ovanför)
katto (huoneessa, joka ei ole rakennuksen ylin huone)
plafond (pas celui de la pièce du dernier étage) [AUTOTRANSLATED]

This refers to the ceiling ({'aqroS:n:1}) of a room that has a room above it. The ceiling of a room which is on the top (or only) story of a structure is called its {pa' beb:n}.[2]
The first element of this word is {rav:n:1} "floor", but the second element is unrelated to {'eq:v} "be early".[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: Note that this is a verb in Klingon. In Klingon, one says "it lightnings", similar to how one says "it rains" in English.

table.name: mem
table.column: an aquatic bird with colorful plumage
یک پرنده آبزی با پرهای رنگی [AUTOTRANSLATED]
um pássaro aquático com plumagem colorida
eräs vesilintu, jolla on värikkäät höyhenet
un oiseau aquatique au plumage coloré [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: A geneticist would presumably be a {raytej:n}, though it's unclear what the root {ray:n:hyp,nolink} means.
Gene "R"oddenberry. Also, {ray:n} may be an abbrevation for {roSghaH:n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This word does not appear in canon, but is an obvious construction based on {rayQeD:n:nolink}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is intended for use by people, whereas a {HuDyar:n} is typically used for storing things, although there is overlap between them.
The groundskeeper at Starfleet Academy, Boothby, was portrayed by Ray Walston.

table.name: mem
table.column: приказывать, отдавать команду, отдавать приказание, повелевать, командовать

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a triangle with one angle of 90 {lawrI'mey:n@@lawrI':n, -mey:n} or 60.75 {lawmey:n@@law:n, -mey:n}. Each of the two "sides" or "catheti" adjacent to the right angle is called a {DeS:n:3}.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is normally shortened to just {ra'Duch qubbID:n} or, even more frequently when the context is clear, to just {qubbID:n:2}.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column:
This is a triangle where each interior angle is 40.5 {lawmey:n:nolink}, or 60 {lawrI'mey:n:nolink}. (See {law:n} and {lawrI':n}.)
For other polygons with equal sides/angles, {HoS:v} is used instead of {tIQ:v:nolink}.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: grupo de comando, pessoal de comando
groupe de commandement, état-major de commandement [AUTOTRANSLATED]
This word is not defined, but its meaning is clear from the example and from {ra'ghomquv:n:nolink}.

▶ {tera' jar Soch, DIS wa' Hut jav Hut, maSDaq SaqmeH Qu' wa'DIch HochHom turlu'taHvIS, wej logh lengwI'pu' pa'mey 'oH Apollo wa'maH wa' ra'ghom bobcho' Columbia'e'.:sen:nolink} "The Apollo 11 Command Module, 'Columbia,' was the living quarters for the three-person crew during most of the first manned lunar landing mission in July 1969."

table.name: mem
table.column: The High Command runs the {tlhIngan Hubbeq:n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: raktaj, kaffe med sprit i, ett slags dryck
eräs juoma, jossa kahviin on sekoitettu alkoholia

This is a drink made from liquor added to coffee. Its name may have originated as a contraction of {ra'wI' taj:n:nolink}. An "export" version called "raktajino", popular in the Federation, is not alcoholic, but has added flavour.[1, p.96]

table.name: mem
table.column: commander (any officer of rank {Sogh:n:nolink} or higher)
commandant (tout officier de grade {Sogh:n:nolink} ou supérieur) [AUTOTRANSLATED]

This refers to someone of rank {Sogh:n} or higher, and may be used either as a description or a title.[2]
Do not confuse this with {la':n}, which is also translated as "commander" in English.[2]
Относится к кому-то с рангом {Sogh:n} или выше.[2]
Tämä viittaa henkilöön, jonka sotilasarvo on luutnantti ({Sogh:n}) tai korkeampi.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: "Retch". Also, the words for inhale and exhale together sound like "poor wretch" ({pur rech:sen:nolink}).

table.name: mem
table.column: In geometry, this word refers to the side of a polygon.[1]
In the geometry usage, this word's only appearance in canon has been between a number and one of {mey':n} or {'Impey':n}.

table.name: mem
table.column:
This is an extension of {reD:n:1} to refer to an object's surface which is not the top, bottom, front, or back. In this context, the front of the object is its {logh'ob:n:2} and the back is its {Sa'Hut:n:2}.[1; 2]
Even when applied to a person or an animal, this doesn't take the suffix {-Du':n:suff}, because it refers to an area and not a specific body part. This word does not mean "side" in the sense of one of two opposite directions such as "left" and "right" or "top" and "bottom", for which see {Dop:n}.[3]

An explanation of {logh'ob:n:2,nolink}, {Sa'Hut:n:2,nolink}, and {reD:n:3,nolink} was given during the Q & A session at {Saarbrücken qepHom'a' 2021:src}.
This was defined as "side". The clarification "exterior surface" was added based on the explanation, and to differentiate it from {Dop:n:nolink}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is the chemical element with the symbol F and atomic number 9.
Backwards of "guilder", a coin or unit of currency also used interchangeably with "florin".

table.name: mem
table.column: Backwards of "(Darth) Vader". Another word for "shortage" is "dearth".

table.name: mem
table.column: The slang expression {pumnuj reD'eS:n@@pumnuj:n, reD'eS:n} is used if things are definitely inefficient.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: A planet in the Romulan Star Empire.
Планета в составе Ромуланской звездной империи.

table.name: mem
table.column: There is an idiom, {tun; reghuluS 'Iwghargh rur@@tun:v, reghuluS 'Iwghargh:n, rur:v}.
Есть идиома, {tun; reghuluS 'Iwghargh rur@@tun:v, reghuluS 'Iwghargh:n, rur:v}.

table.name: mem
table.column: Sometimes, it may be appropriate to use {-taH:v:suff} (without {reH:adv}) to translate "always". For example, see {Duj tIvoqtaH.:sen}
Иногда может быть подходящим использование {-taH:v:suff} (без {reH:adv}) чтобы перевести "всегда". Для примера смотрите {Duj tIvoqtaH.:sen}

table.name: mem
table.column: The difference between this and {Quj:v} is that this refers to unstructured play, whereas {Quj:v:nolink} refers to structured play. This verb does not take {'e':n:pro} as its object.[2]
Разница между этим словом и {Quj:v} в том, что данное слово относится к неструктурированной игре, в то время как {Quj:v:nolink} относится к структурированной игре.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: The used kut'luch is always shiny.
Ein benutztes Kut'luch ist immer blank.
kut'luch استفاده می شود همیشه براق است. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
En använd kut'luch är alltid blank.
使用過的kut'luch總是有光澤的。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
O kut'luch usado é sempre brilhante.
Le kut'luch utilisé est toujours brillant. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: Your father is a part of you always.
Dein Vater ist immer ein Teil von dir.
پدر شما همیشه بخشی از شماست [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Din far är alltid en del av dig.
Твой отец всегда будет частью тебя.
你的父親永遠是你的一部分。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Seu pai é sempre uma parte de você.
Votre père fait toujours partie de vous. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: Always it is the brave ones who die.
Es sind immer die tapferen, die sterben.
همیشه آنهایی که شجاع هستند که میمیرند. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Det är alltid de modiga som dör.
Всегда есть кто-то храбрый, кто умирает.
Sempre são os corajosos que morrem.
Ce sont toujours les plus courageux qui meurent. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: May you always find a bloodworm in your glass!
Mögest du immer einen Blutwurm in deinem Glas finden!
همیشه می توانید کرم خونی را در شیشه خود پیدا کنید! [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Må du alltid finna en blodmask i ditt glas!
Пусть ты всегда будешь находить кровавого червя а твоем стакане.
願你總能在你的杯子裡找到一隻紅蟲！ [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Que você sempre encontre um verme de sangue em seu copo!
Puissiez-vous toujours trouver un ver de vase dans votre verre ! [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: reH latlh qabDaq qul tuj law' Hoch tuj puS.
The fire is always hotter on someone else's face.
Auf einem anderen Gesicht ist das Feuer immer am heißesten.
آتش همیشه روی صورت شخص دیگری داغتر است. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Elden är alltid hetare i någon annans ansikte.
Огонь всегда горячее на чьем-то лице.
別人臉上的火焰總是更熱。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
O fogo é sempre mais quente no rosto de outra pessoa.
Tuli on aina kuumempaa jonkun toisen kasvoilla.
Le feu est toujours plus brûlant sur le visage de quelqu'un d'autre. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: Il y a toujours des armes. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Siehe wie Gowron dies sagt: {YouTube video:url:http://youtu.be/jCLUZvNDFZw}
Смотрите, как Гаурон говорит это: {YouTube video:url:http://youtu.be/jCLUZvNDFZw}

table.name: mem
table.column: A Klingon warrior is always prepared to fight.
Ein Klingonenkrieger ist immer auf den Kampf vorbereitet.
جنگجوی کلینگان همیشه آماده مبارزه است. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
En klingonsk krigare är alltid beredd på strid.
克林崗戰士總是準備戰鬥。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Um guerreiro klingon está sempre preparado para lutar.
Un guerrier Klingon est toujours prêt à se battre. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: A great warrior is always prepared.
Ein großer Krieger ist immer für den Kampf bereit.
یک جنگجوی بزرگ همیشه آماده است. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
En stor krigare är alltid beredd.
一個偉大的戰士總是準備好。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Um grande guerreiro está sempre preparado.
Mahtava soturi on aina valmis taistelemaan.
Un grand guerrier est toujours préparé. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: One is always of his tribe.
Man gehört immer zu seinem Stamm.
یکی از همیشه قبیله اش است. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Man är alltid del av sin ätt.
Um é sempre da sua tribo.
Henkilö on aina yhtä heimonsa kanssa.
On est toujours de sa tribu. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: May the Klingon Empire continue forever.
Möge das klingonische Imperium auf ewig fortbestehen.
ممکن است امپراطوری کلینگان برای همیشه ادامه یابد. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Må det klingonska imperiet vara för evigt!
願克林崗帝國永遠持續下去。
Que o Império Klingon continue para sempre.
Puisse l'Empire Klingon perdurer pour toujours. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: Il y a toujours une chance. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: I will remember this dinner forever.
Ich werde mich immer an dieses Abendessen erinnern.
من این شام را برای همیشه به یاد خواهم آورد. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Jag kommer minnas denna middag för evigt!
Я буду помнить этот ужин вечно.
我將會永遠記住這頓晚餐。
Vou me lembrar desse jantar para sempre.
Je me souviendrai toujours de ce dîner. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to underwear in general. It is a mass noun with no singular counterpart. To be more specific, say {rejghun yIvbeH:n@@rejghun:n, yIvbeH:n:1} and so on. Though {yopwaH:n} normally refers to long pants, {rejghun yopwaH:n} are typically shorts. One could say {rejghun yopwaH bID:n@@rejghun:n, yopwaH bID:n}, but it's not necessary. When the distinction is necessary, {rejghun yopwaH naQ:n@@rejghun:n, yopwaH:n, naQ:v} can be used to refer to long johns (underpants with long legs).[1; 2]
"Reg Grundies" is Australian slang for underwear.

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to underpants with long legs. This is used when a distinction is necessary with {rejghun yopwaH bID:n}.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: ängslare, fjant, pessimist (person som oroar sig mycket)
This is missing from the E-K side of {TKD:src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: He was a follower of {tIquvma:n:name} who was given the role of {Sech qengwI':n}. He was the brother of {'or'eq:n:name}.

table.name: mem
table.column: vara vimmelkantig, vara omtöcknad, vara förvirrad, ha vanföreställningar, inbilla sig saker
This means dazed in the sense of confused, unable to think properly, bewildered.[1] It means delusional, in this sense.[2]
Dies bedeutet verwirrt, unfähig klar zu denken.

table.name: mem
table.column: sucer (par exemple, avec de la paille) [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: In its singular sense, this refers to any individual internal organ. Used in the plural sense (with or without {-Du':n:suff}), it refers to "guts", "bowels", "entrails".[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: This appears to be composed from {rem:v} and {'ay':n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This word is used to describe the design of a physical object of some sort; it would not be used in the sense of making a plan to do something (which would be {nab:v}). It differs from {'ogh:v}, which implies the creation of something which has not been created before.
Christopher Wren and James Renwick, Jr., were the names of two famous architects.

table.name: mem
table.column: This was written with a space in the programme.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: See {'arlogh Qoylu'pu'?:sen} for some ways to tell time.
▶ {rep yIper!:sen} (to ask for the time in the Federation system, see {tera' poH:n}) ▶ {tera' rep cha':sen:nolink} or {rep cha':sen:nolink} "two o'clock" (in the Federation system)

table.name: mem
table.column: A slang way to say this is {ghaw':n:3}.

table.name: mem
table.column: shrimp-like creature, a type of animal
créature ressemblant à une crevette, un type d'animal [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: kasta en besvärjelse, kasta en förtrollning, trolla
One can say either {tlheH reS@@tlheH:n, reS:v:1} or just {reS:sen:nolink} for "he/she casts a spell". It's unclear if anything other than {tlheH:n} can be the object of {reS:v:1,nolink}.

table.name: mem
table.column: faire pousser (p. ex. des fleurs, des plantes, des légumes) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
The object is the plant which is grown by the subject.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column:
If it's necessary to make a distinction between the shin and the outer side of the forearm, this word can be preceded by {'uS:n} or {DeS:n:1}.
This refers to the front of the lower leg, whereas the entire lower part of the leg would be {'uS cha'neH:n}.
The only way Maltz was aware of to refer to the shin bone is {reStav Hom:n@@reStav:n, Hom:n:1}.
The Hebrew letter "shin" comes between the letters "resh" and "tav".

table.name: mem
table.column: période de temps il y a (passée) [AUTOTRANSLATED]

A specialised word is used to indicate a time in the past for the following units: ▶ {jaj:n} "day" - {Hu':n} "days ago" ▶ {jar:n} "month" - {wen:n} "months ago" ▶ {DIS:n:2} "year" - {ben:n:1} "years ago"
For other units of time, {ret:n:nolink} is used.[1]
This is the same word as the verb {ret:v}.[2]
▶ {cha' tup ret:n@@cha':n, tup:n, ret:n} "two minutes ago"

table.name: mem
table.column: This is the same word as the noun {ret:n}.

▶ {cha' tup ret jIQuch:sen:nolink} "Two minutes ago, I was happy." ▶ {qaStaHvIS cha' tup ret jIQuch:sen:nolink} "I was happy during the past (that is, most recent) two minutes." or "...for the past two minutes." or "... over the past two minutes." ▶ {qep'a' ret:n:nolink} "the most recent {qep'a':sen:nolink}"

▶ {cha' tup ret jIQuch:sen:nolink} "Vor zwei Minuten war ich glücklich." ▶ {qaStaHvIS cha' tup ret jIQuch:sen:nolink} "Ich war glücklich während den aktuellen (d.h. gerade vergangenen) zwei Minuten" or "...in den letzten zwei Minuten." ▶ {qep'a' ret:n:nolink} "das letzte / gerade passierte {qep'a':sen:nolink}"

table.name: mem
table.column: دست زدن، چنگ زدن (از چاقو، بته) [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: This does not refer to how to format a paragraph.

table.name: mem
table.column: منطقه در کنار، منطقه در کنار [AUTOTRANSLATED]
área ao lado, área ao lado de
zone à côté, zone à côté [AUTOTRANSLATED]
To be more specific, one can use {tlhop:n:1}, {'em:n}, {poS:n}, or {nIH:n}. See also {lurgh:n} for other words related to spatial directions.
Чтобы быть более точным, можно использовать {tlhop:n:1}, {'em:n}, {poS:n}, или {nIH:n}. Смотрите также {lurgh:n} для других слов, отнесенных к пространственным направлениям.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is used for citing the speech or writing of someone else.

table.name: mem
table.column: zusammendrücken und auseinander ziehen (Spielen eines Dudelsacks)
espremer e esticar (instrumento de bolsa de ar)
This refers to the action of alternately squeezing and stretching out the bag part of the {may'ron:n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: une performance ou une présentation spéciale [AUTOTRANSLATED]

This noun refers to a performance or presentation that's pretty special in some way. Maybe it's something that happens only once, not to be repeated. Or maybe it occurs regularly but not very often, so it's something which is looked forward to well in advance. Maybe it's something that features a special performer or performers.[1]

Dies ist ein nomen das man nicht einfach mit zwei Wörtern erklären kann, abe es ist eine Art Aufführung oder Darbietung, die an sich irgendwie besonders ist. Vielleicht passiert sie nur einmal, und wird nicht wiederholt. Oder vielleicht findet sie nur sehr selten satt, also ist es etwas, auf das man sich besonders lange im Voraus freut. Vielleicht ist es ein Auftritt mit besonderen Künstlern.[1]
The KLI Cabaret is a special performance which takes place at the {qep'a':n} (making it a {qep'a' rey':n:nolink}).

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to a scarf wrapped around the neck for warmth.[1]
"Scarf osteotomy" is a surgical procedure used in treating foot deformity due to rheumatoid arthritis.

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to a sharp fragment of material such as glass, metal, rock, or pottery.[1]
The Shard, a landmark in London, was designed by architect Renzo Piano.

table.name: mem
table.column: The scientific name for the sperm whale is "Physeter macrocephalus".

table.name: mem
table.column: keinotekoinen elinympäristö, habitaatti (asutusrakennelma planeetalla tai avaruudessa)
This is a "sci-fi" word for living structures on alien planets, or in space.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: This means to be spread out like a deck of cards fanned on a table or peanut butter on a piece of bread.
A rib spreader is a surgical implement for thoracic surgery.

table.name: mem
table.column: بحث در مورد بحث در مورد [AUTOTRANSLATED]
The object of the verb is the topic of discussion.
Das Objekt des Verbes ist das Subjekt, über das man spricht.

table.name: mem
table.column: This was requested specifically to translate "Prime Directive".

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to the process that food goes through.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is the closest Klingon equivalent to barley.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: ge energi till, koppla på, aktivera
питать энергией, активизировать, запускать, заряжать, пропускать ток
One first charges up ({Huj:v:2,t}) a device before energizing ({rIH:v:nolink}) it.

table.name: mem
table.column: When the context is clear, this is sometimes called simply {rIjwI':n}.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column:
This word is used by small children, or by adults talking to or about small children. Adults typically use {Sen:v:1} instead.
The reflexive form of this verb has a special meaning. See the example below, and under {SIq:v} for an explanation.
This is a reference to the nursery rhyme "Little Jack Horner" (see {rIlwI':n}).
▶ {nujDajDaq rIl'egh ghu.:sen:nolink} "The baby sucks its thumb."

table.name: mem
table.column: The usage of this verb is restricted to the {gheb:n}, while {SuS:v} is a more general term that applies to all wind instruments.

This is a reference to the nursery rhyme "Little Jack Horner" (see {rIlwI':n}).
In addition, {gheb rIl:sen@@gheb:n, rIl:v:2} is a reference to the horn of Gabriel.

table.name: mem
table.column: This word is used by small children, or by adults talking to or about small children. Adults typically use {SenwI':n} instead.

The nursery rhyme "Little Jack Horner" is about a child who used his thumb ({rIl:v:1}), to pull out a plum from a Christmas pie. Since {rIl:v:2} means "to play (a horn)", {rIlwI':n:nolink} is a reference to the name "Horner".

table.name: mem
table.column:
It was confirmed during the Q & A session at {qep'a'2 27 (2020):src} that this is not grammatically considered a body part.
"Hoar" + "moan" (hoar frost is like rime ice, and a moan is a bit like a howl ({bey:n})).

table.name: mem
table.column: быть завершенным, быть законченным, быть выполненным
être accompli, être terminé, être réalisé, être atteint, être fini

This verb is used with the suffix {-taH:v} to form {rIntaH:v}, a construction used to indicate finality (cf. the suffix {-ta':v}).[1]
By itself, {rIn:v:nolink} is used in radio transmissions to indicate end of transmission, similar to "over".[2]

Глагол используется вместе с суффиксом {-taH:v} чтобы сформировать {rIntaH:v}, т.е конструкцию, чтобы обозначить завершение процесса (сравните с суффиксом {-ta':v}).[1]
Сам по себе, {rIn:v:nolink} используется в радио передачах, чтобы обозначить окончание передаваемого сообщения, что очень похоже на "конец связи".[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This special verbal construction follows another verb to indicate that the action described by the preceding verb is a fait accompli. It is similar in meaning to the verb suffix {-ta':v:suff}, but has the additional connotation of finality.

Эта специальная конструкция следует за другим глаголом, чтобы обозначить, что действие, описанное в предыдущем глаголе, является свершившимся фактом. Очень похоже по значению на глагольный суффикс {-ta':v:suff}, но имеет дополнительную коннотацию законченности.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is missing from the E-K side of {TKD:src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: inventar, fazer uma descoberta, romper, inovar
olla uranuurtaja, tehdä läpimurto, olla uudistaja
être les pionniers de, percer, innover
This would apply to a scientific breakthrough or discovery, but not to, say, setting a new record in a bat'leth twirling competition.

table.name: mem
table.column: быть раненым, быть поврежденным, быть травмированным

The sentence from {Klingon Monopoly:src} implies that this can be translated "be damaged" through metonymy (it is referring to a player's ships, which are non-living things, but the player is the actual subject).
▶ {Dumer DIvI' QaS 'ej DuHIv, vaj bIwunchoH 'ej bIrIQchoH.:sen:nolink} "Surprise attack by Federation leaves you unprotected and damaged."[2]
▶ {Dumer DIvI' QaS 'ej DuHIv, vaj bIwunchoH 'ej bIrIQchoH.:sen:nolink} "Неожиданная атака Федерации оставила вас незащищенным и поврежденным."[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: make a cracking, snapping, or clicking sound; emit a signal (could be sound, radiation, smell, etc.)
ein knackendes oder klickendes Geräusch machen, ein Signal aussenden
صدای ترک خوردن یا تکان دادن را ایجاد کنید، یک سیگنال را منتشر کردن [AUTOTRANSLATED]
göra ett knäppande eller snäppande ljud, avge en signal [AUTOTRANSLATED]
издать треск или щелчок, подать сигнал [AUTOTRANSLATED]
發出破裂或劈啪聲、發出信號 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
fazer um som de estalido ou estalo, emitir um sinal
tehdä naksahtava tai napsahtava ääni; lähettää ulos signaali, säteillä, erittää, päästää
émettre un bruit de craquelure, de claquement ou de cliquetis ; émettre un signal (peut être un son, un rayonnement, une odeur, etc.)

This word originally referred only to emitting sound. Later, the meaning was extended to mean emitting any sort of signal: sound, radiation, smell, etc. In comparison, {tlhuD:v} refers only to the emission of radiation.

Snap, Crackle, Pop are the cartoon mascots of Rice Krispies, a breakfast cereal.
At {Saarbrücken qepHom'a' 2017:src}, the definition included only "a cracking and snapping sound". At {qep'a' 28 (2021):src}, this was expanded to include "clicking".
[1] {Saarbrücken qepHom'a' 2017:src}, [2] {DSC - Battle at the Binary Stars:src}, [3] {qep'a' 28 (2021):src}

table.name: mem
table.column: ▶ {rIS tlhen:sen@@rIS:n, tlhen:v} "(it) produces a click sound"[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: Wilshire ({wIlSIr:sen:nolink}) Boulevard in Los Angeles originated as a path used by the Tongva people to bring tar from the La Brea pits to their settlement.

table.name: mem
table.column: kutsua joku tai jotkut (paikalle tai koolle)
A "writ of summons" is a legal document notifying a party to appear before a court.
▶ {DurIt tlhIngan yejquv.:sen:nolink} "Summoned to the Klingon High Council."[1]

table.name: mem
table.column:
There is no noun in Klingon meaning "color".[1, p.81]
This also refers to ink, as for a rubber stamp ({toqwIn:n}).[2]
"Ritz" is a brand of paint or dye.

table.name: mem
table.column: For example, this is what an ax does to a watermelon.

table.name: mem
table.column: This was defined only as "hail". The "communication" clarification was added to distinguish it from the weather phenomenon ({Heq:v}).

table.name: mem
table.column: balise, fanal, phare, feu de signal

table.name: mem
table.column: This is defined as "trunk (of body)" in {TKD:src} and glossed as "torso" in the text of {KGT:src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to an imaginary line around which an object spins or is symmetrically arranged.
Dies bezieht sich auf eine imaginäre Linie, um die sich ein Objekt dreht oder symmetrisch angeordnet ist.
The Rome-Berlin Axis was a coalition between Italy and Germany in World War II.

table.name: mem
table.column: This can be the object of {naj:v} "dream" or {SIQ:v} "endure" and some other verbs, but generally not {ghaj:v} "have" (unless you somehow literally possess a nightmare).

William Shatner played a character named Robert Wilson in the Twilight Zone episode "Nightmare at 20,000 Feet".
One of the tracks on the Robin Williams comedy album "Reality... What a Concept" is named "Shakespeare (A Meltdowner's Nightmare)", but this is probably a genuine concidence.

table.name: mem
table.column: Dennis Gabor was the inventor of holography.

table.name: mem
table.column: به طور معمول، به طور منظم، به طور منظم [AUTOTRANSLATED]
習慣性地、習慣性地、定期地 [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to a dimension within a coordinate system, not another dimension like in a parallel universe (for which see {'u' quq:n} and {'u' Dop:n}).

Rod Serling's opening narrations (of which there are several) for the TV show "The Twilight Zone" all refer to entering or traveling through another dimension. For example: "You are about to enter another dimension, a dimension not only of sight and sound but of mind."

table.name: mem
table.column: Informally, the term {tlhepwI':n} is often used.[1]
Backwards of "nose door". One of the functions of the uvula is to close off the nasopharynx when swallowing.

table.name: mem
table.column: få att jäsa, bringa i jäsning

table.name: mem
table.column: заключать мир, добиваться мира, достигать мира, устанавливать мир

table.name: mem
table.column: ▶ {DIvI' rojmab qep ghanglu' 'e' nIDlu', 'ach taH qep.:sen:nolink} "Despite efforts to halt them, peace talks with Federation continue."[1]
▶ {DIvI' rojmab qep ghanglu' 'e' nIDlu', 'ach taH qep.:sen:nolink} "Несмотря на усилия для прекращения, разговоры о мире с Федерацией продолжаются."[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to hair on the face which covers the chin and neck area.[2]
Относится к волосам на лице, которые покрывают зону подбородка и шеи.[2]
Refere-se a pelos no rosto que cobrem a área do queixo e pescoço.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This word is also used by Klingon grammarians to refer to the rule that governs the use of pronominal prefixes, a rule Federation grammarians call "agreement".[2]
Это слово также используется Клингонскими филологами, чтобы упомянуть о правиле, которое определяет использование суффиксов местоимений. Правило Федерации филологи называют "соглашением".[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: Backwards of "Nevermore" (see {not:adv}), a reference to "The Raven" by Poe. "Corbel" derives from a Latin word for raven.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is considered too potent for tourists.

table.name: mem
table.column: There is an idiom, {matlhHa'; romuluSngan rur}.

table.name: mem
table.column: 羅慕蘭獵人殺手探測器 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
This is also called {HoHwI':n} for short.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is the metallic chemical element with the symbol Zn and atomic number 30.

table.name: mem
table.column:
In the context of playing dice, this word refers to the action of the dice as they are rolling. (To "throw" or "roll" the dice would be {ronmoH:v:nolink}.)[1]
When applied to a person, it means the person is rolling haphazardly. To perform a somersault is {Hay:v}, and to roll down a hill (like a log) is {tetlh:v}.[2]
This verb can be applied to aircraft, for which see {ron:v:2}.

Tätä käytetään nopista kun ne pyörivät heittämisen jälkeen (heittäminen itsessään on {ronmoH:v:nolink}).[1]
Henkilön yhteydessä tämä viittaa sattumanvaraiseen kierimiseen tai vierimiseen (kuperkeikasta sanotaan {Hay:v}, ja mäkeä alas vieriminen on {tetlh:v}).[2]
Tällä on täsmällinen merkitys lentokoneista puhuttaessa, ks. {ron:v:2}.

▶ {mI' naghmey tIronmoH:sen:nolink} "throw dice"[1] ▶ {ron SuvwI'; chorgh 'ujmey lID:sen@@ron:v:1, SuvwI':n, chorgh:n:1, 'uj:n, -mey:n, lID:v} or {chorgh 'ujmey lID SuvwI'; ron:sen@@chorgh:n:1, 'uj:n, -mey:n, lID:v, SuvwI':n, ron:v:1} "the warrior rolled (haphazardly) for eight ujes"[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: roll (aircraft wings tilt, one up, one down)
rollen (Flugzeugflügel neigen sich, einer nach oben, einer nach unten)
رول (بال هواپیما شیب ، یکی به بالا ، یکی به پایین) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
vara bankande, vara rollande, vara krängande (flygmaskin roterar runt sin ländaxel), vara rullande (om tärning)
крен (наклон крыльев самолета, один вверх, один вниз) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
滾動（飛機機翼傾斜，一上一下） [AUTOTRANSLATED]
rolar (asas da aeronave inclinadas, uma para cima, uma para baixo)
rouler (les ailes de l'avion s'inclinent, une vers le haut, l'autre vers le bas)
This is just the verb {ron:v:1} applied to aircraft. For a pilot to roll an aircraft would be {ronmoH:v:nolink}.
The aile"ron"s control the roll on an airplane.
▶ {ron muD Duj; javmaH lawrI'mey lID:sen@@ron:v:2, muD Duj:n, jav:n:1, maH:n:2, lawrI':n, -mey:n, lID:v} "the airplane rolled 60 degrees"

table.name: mem
table.column: This can be used generally, not just for how Terrans tend to ruin food.[1]
This is preparing food in the "wrong" way, from a Klingon point of view.

table.name: mem
table.column: быть хворым, быть больным, быть заболевшим, быть нездоровым

table.name: mem
table.column: Diseases are referred to by the name for the disease followed by {rop:n:nolink}.[2]
Болезни упоминаются путем наименования болезни, за которым следует {rop:n:nolink}.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to any epidemic, and not specifically the infectious disease caused by the bacterium Yersinia pestis.
This word was not given a definition in isolation, and appears only as a component of {ruDelya' rop'a':n:nolink}.

table.name: mem
table.column: Les Klingons ne tombent pas malades. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: рубец (от болезни, инфекции и т. д.) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
cicatrice (due à une maladie, une infection, etc.) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
This is a scar which is the result of some sort of disease, infection, etc.
Eine Narbe als Resultat einer Krankheit, Infektion, usw.
This was defined as just "scar", with an accompanying explanation of the kinds of scars.

table.name: mem
table.column: This line was spoken in Klingon but was not subtitled.
Это было сказано на Клингонском, но не сопровождалось субтитрами

table.name: mem
table.column: be fragile, be delicate, be flimsy
zerbrechlich sein, zart sein, dünn sein
شکننده باشید، ظریف باشید، نازک باشید [AUTOTRANSLATED]
vara ömtålig, vara känslig, vara tunn [AUTOTRANSLATED]
быть хрупким, быть нежным, быть хрупким [AUTOTRANSLATED]
變得脆弱，變得脆弱，變得脆弱 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
ser frágil, ser delicado, ser frágil [AUTOTRANSLATED]
être fragile, être délicat, être fragile [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: This word refrs to anyone not a member of the group under discussion. Hence a non-military person in contrast to military personnel, a non-government worker in contrast to government workers, a non-Klingon speaker in contrast to Klingon speakers, etc. This is not used to contrast races, species, nationalities, etc. (For example, it would not be used for a non-Klingon or non-Swede.)[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: быть толстым, быть упитанным, быть жирным

This implies bulk due to body fat or the like, while {pI':v} does not have this connotation. Both can be used to express "not thin", but {ror:v:nolink} is more appropriate to convey "not lean". When this verb is used to describe an inanimate object, there is usually a bit of anthropomorphizing, likening the object to a person or an animal.[2]
A "fat book" would be a {paq qargh:n@@paq:n:1, qargh:v}, unless the book comes to life as a character in a cartoon or something like that. (In that case, the plural suffix {-pu':n:suff} might also be expected.)[2]
This was defined as just "be fat" in {TKD:src}. The clarification was added at {Saarbrücken qepHom'a' 2019:src}.

table.name: mem
table.column:
This is "be fantastic" in the fantasy sense; it does not mean "be wonderful, terrific".[1]
The concept of a "fairy tale" might be expressed as {puq lut:n@@puq:n, lut:n} or {lut rorgh:n@@lut:n, rorgh:v} or {puq lut rorgh:n@@puq:n, lut:n, rorgh:v}.[2]
This word is also used in mathematics to refer to imaginary numbers ({mI' rorgh:n}).[3]
Ricardo Montalbán (Khan Noonien Singh) played Mr. Roarke on the TV series Fantasy Island.

table.name: mem
table.column: This little piggy had roast beef.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a slang term based on {roS:v:1} or {roS:v:2}, and meaning {qIS:v}.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: According to {HQ 10.2:src}[3], this verb consists of three elements: the verb {roS:v:3,is,hyp}, {-Ha':v}, and {-moH:v}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This little piggy had roast beef.

table.name: mem
table.column:
"He licks", helix.
It was confirmed during the Q & A session at {qep'a'2 27 (2020):src} that this is not grammatically considered a body part.

table.name: mem
table.column: Chromosomes are numbered (e.g., {roSmaH wej:n:nolink}). The two sex chromosomes are {roSmaH pagh:n:nolink} and {roSmaH bID:n:nolink}. Two {roSmaH bID:n:nolink} chromosomes occur in females, and one of each occur in males.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: быть жестким, быть грубым, быть крутым

table.name: mem
table.column: The game "rock-paper-scissors" is also known as "roshambo", and "rock" is basically a fist.

table.name: mem
table.column: مشت خود را به من نشان دهید [AUTOTRANSLATED]

This idiomatic expression is used to challenge someone to take action in a manner consistent with something he or she just said. (It's similar to the English expression "put your money where your mouth is".)
Данное идиоматическое выражение очень похоже на "ответь за свои слова" или "перейти от слов к делу".
challenge, put your money where your mouth is

table.name: mem
table.column: اصطلاح اصطلاحی که کنتراست را بیان می کند [AUTOTRANSLATED]
expression idiomatique qui exprime le contraste [AUTOTRANSLATED]
This literally means "if the open hand becomes a fist". It is used in a similar fashion to the English expression "on the other hand".
Tämä tarkoittaa kirjaimellisesti "jos avoimesta kädestä tulee nyrkki". Sitä käytetään ilmaisemaan vastakkainasettelua samoin kuin suomen sanaa "toisaalta".

table.name: mem
table.column: This is the closest Klingon equivalent to the marine crustacean that attaches itself to submerged surfaces.[1]
"Barnacle Bill the Sailor" is the name of a drinking song.

table.name: mem
table.column: Almond Roca is a brand of toffee. In German, both "tonsil" and "almond" are "Mandel".

table.name: mem
table.column: One of its ingredients is the {DayquS:n} plant.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column:
Possibly a reference to a specific politician, though the resemblance might just be a genuine coincidence.
The original request wasn't neutral: "A person who is professionally involved in politics. Also a derogatory term for a person who manipulates or pleases others just to gain own advantage. For example, Gowron is described as a politician in DS9." Based on this, it seems the term may be used in a derogatory manner, to mean something like "political careerist" or "political opportunist".

table.name: mem
table.column: ادامه دهید، پیش بروید، انجام دهید [AUTOTRANSLATED]
приступать, действовать, осуществлять, сделать это, идти вперед к цели
continuer, procéder, y aller, le faire

This was used with an object in {Hamlet:src}.
This was used for "Ok" (while {qIl:v} was used for "Cancel") in Klingon Blockly.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: ▶ {qarDaSQa'Daq ruDelya' rop'a' Hergh qengbogh yo' Dabot.:sen:nolink} "Intercept Rudellian plague relief convoy to Cardassian Union."[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: corar (corar o rosto devido a emoções)
Maltz asserts that Klingons never blush.
Maltz behauptet, dass Klingonen niemals rot werden.
This was confirmed as intransitive during the Q & A session.

table.name: mem
table.column: be physical (subject to laws of physics)
быть физическим (в соответствии с законами физики) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
是物理的（服從物理定律） [AUTOTRANSLATED]
ser físico (sujeito às leis da física)
être physique (soumis aux lois de la physique)
This means that something is subject to the laws of physics; it could be applied to something corporeal but also to energy.[1]

table.name: mem
mem
table.column: From the children's rhyme, a teapot is "short" ({run:v}) and "stout" ({pI':v}). Also, too much tee makes a person go "run and pee".

table.name: mem
table.column: штрафовать, оштрафовать, обложить налогом, установить цену

table.name: mem
table.column: The gas produced is called {SIp:n} (a general word for gas of any kind) or {Qep'It:n} (a gas produced within the body).[1] To distinguish between gas emission from different orifices, use a phrase involving {nuj:n}, {Hugh:n}, or {Sa'Hut:n:1}.[2]
From the Latin "eructare", or the English "eructation". The belch definition came from {HQ 12.4:src}[1]. It was expanded to also mean fart in a message to the {KLI mailing list:src}.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a city in {ghevchoq Sep:n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to controlling or handling something that can or may do something on its own (or due to some source of power), but the manual intervention causes it to do something else or behave differently. It is more likely to be used when the handling alters the configuration of the thing being manipulated, in comparison to {raQ:v:nolink} (which is used if the thing being handled doesn't do anything if it's not being handled). One might {ruQ:v:nolink} a robot vacuum cleaner by picking it up and reorienting it. One would not {ruQ:v:nolink} a {betleH:n} (unless it's an adjustable {betleH:n:nolink} of some sort). If one were to {ruQ:v:nolink} a work of art, that would suggest the artwork is manipulable in some way. Controlling the thrusters by pushing a button or two would be {raQ:v:nolink}, but manually controlling them by physically doing something to them directly, like yanking a thruster component, twisting something, or banging on something, would be {ruQ:v:nolink}.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: походить на кого-то, иметь сходство, быть похожим на

This verb is used to form similes, such as {puj verengan; bIQ rur@@puj:v, verengan:n, bIQ:n, rur:v} "the Ferengi is as weak as water".[2; 4] It can also be used to translate "like" in the sense of "looks like".[3]

Этот глагол используется для формирования сравнений, например {puj verengan; bIQ rur@@puj:v, verengan:n, bIQ:n, rur:v} "Ференги слабые, как вода".[2; 4] Также может использоваться, чтобы перевести "как" в смысле "выглядит как".[3]
Possibly a reference to the science fiction play R.U.R. (Rossum's Universal Robots) by Karel Čapek.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a Klingon penal colony, a planet mostly covered in ice. Prisoners are sent to work in its {tlhIlHalmey:n@@tlhIlHal:n, -mey:n}.
Клингонская каторжная колония, планета преимущественно покрытая льдом. Заключенные посланы туда, чтобы там работать {tlhIlHalmey:n@@tlhIlHal:n, -mey:n}.
The name is based on Rorapandi, the penal colony island in the Disney movie "20,000 Leagues Under the Sea".

table.name: mem
table.column: He can sell ice on Rura Penthe.
Er kann auf Rura Penthe Eis verkaufen.
او می تواند بر روی روور پنته یخ کند. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Han kan sälja is på Rura Penthe.
Он может продать лёд на Рура Пенте.
Ele pode vender gelo no Rura Penthe.
Hän voi myydä jäätä Rura Penthellä.
Il peut vendre de la glace sur Rura Penthe.

table.name: mem
table.column: rhinoceros-like creature, a type of animal
créature ressemblant à un rhinocéros, un type d'animal

table.name: mem
table.column: This describes a bond such as exists between blood brothers.
Описывает связь, наподобие той, что существует между кровными братьями.

table.name: mem
table.column: be positively charged, have a positive charge
مثبت شارژ شود، هزینه ای مثبت داشته باشد [AUTOTRANSLATED]
vara positivt laddad, ha positiv laddning
быть положительно заряженным, иметь положительный заряд [AUTOTRANSLATED]
ter carga positiva, ter uma carga positiva
être chargé positivement, être à charge positive, avoir une charge positive
This was defined as "have a positive charge" in the {qep'a' 23 (2016):src} booklet, but was confirmed to be stative afterwards.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a ritual that allows an orphan to join another House.
Это ритуал, что позволяет сироте присоединиться к другому дому.

table.name: mem
table.column: иногда, временами, время от времени, изредка, нерегулярно
parfois, quelquefois, de temps en temps
This is defined as "sometimes" in {TKD:src} and as "occasionally" in {KGT:src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: هر گاه گاهی اوقات با tribbles مواجه می شوید. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
每個人偶爾都會遇到瑣事。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Tout le monde rencontre des tribules de temps en temps.

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to part of a computer input device (see {'eQway':n}).
Относится к части компьютерного устройства ввода (смотрите {'eQway':n}).

table.name: mem
table.column: Klingons don't traditionally have a sweet dessert at the end of a meal. This term has been heard for "dessert" in the way Terrans think about it.

Maltz didn't understand why it was called this, but guessed someone must have misunderstood something and mistranslated.
In the phrase "just deserts", referring to a deserved punishment or outcome, the word "deserts" is pronounced like (and often confused with) the word "desserts".

table.name: mem
table.column: be ready to collapse or die (referring to food)
kurz davor zu zerfallen, zu sterben sein (im Bezug auf Essen)
آماده شدن برای سقوط یا مرگ (اشاره به غذا) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
vara på väg kollapsa, vara på väg att dö (om mat)
быть готовым рухнуть или умереть (имеется в виду еда) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
準備崩潰或死亡（指食物） [AUTOTRANSLATED]
ser pronto para entrar em colapso ou morrer (referindo-se a comida)
olla valmis kaatumaan ja kuolemaan (ruoasta joka syödään elävänä)
être prêt à s'effondrer ou à mourir (en référence à la nourriture)
This is an upper-class word to describe food that should be eaten live.
